bow: help am currently 30 weeks with my first baby we are making final purchases in prep for him what are your must have items best type of diapers things that were waste of money also what would be best to pack in my hospital bag thank you in advance loved huggies for diapers still use them with lo make sure you pack clothes for you packed sweats and comfortable shirt you re going to be sore after the last thing you want is to have to wear normal clothes make sure to pack baby first outfit and blanket probably hat too depending on the climate where you live sorry your post is getting down voted edit *was getting down voted pack socks not baby socks mommy socks you ll be doing some walking around the ward after baby is born and shoes are pain in the ass when you re sore also comfy clothes for the ride home lanolin if you re going to breastfeed yes the hospital has it it also costs like 40 bucks tube on your bill do worry about diapers your room will be stocked with them wipes burp cloths and blankets and hats just bring home outfit good luck for baby bring both newborn size and month size outfit they re not the same and your baby wo fit one or the other my son is little guy and did think to pack nb size because my ob kept telling me how average sized he was his going home outfit was insanely huge on him new dad here make your burp cloths bright colors so you can find them quickly avoid snap clothes thank you so much will definitely be getting some good socks or slippers thank you for the tip why avoid them just out of curiosity haha just curious what wrong with snap clothes what exactly are they it should be pretty cold here as he will come late january or early february honestly did even think of some of this my mind is trying to keep track of it all haha and thank you not sure why getting downvoted they re not so bad prefer them over zippered pajamas they take longer to snap together around diaper changes and with crying baby every second counts that usually why some people avoid them that makes complete sense could see how snaps would get annoying especially trying to line them up while little one is being wiggly ve also heard many different things about huggies have pampers pure and natural on my registry but really not sure hospital nightgown if you do want to wear hospital gown after kid is born sweats short can get in the way especially if the nurses must check out your vaginal perianum area robe amp socks with tread some hospitals do let you walk around in just socks in case you slip or flip flops outfit for kiddo blanket to cover car seat if in cold climate toiletries that first shower is going to feel sooo good bring your own soaps to make it even better brushing my teeth was also very refreshing if you are on meds ask your dr if you should bring your own cozy maternity clothes to wear home listened to my ipod all through labor very nice at home it was useful to have some padsicles made also wish had taken lot more of the mesh underwear amp icepacks home with me had stool softener at the ready for when got home too the first poo can be uncomfortable waste of for us bouncer swing kid has always hated them electric breast pump the manual one works way better for me we also managed to get lot of free stuff off of craigslist we made sure to check for any recalls on items from there too example we got free bumbo seat that did have the seat belt went to their website amp filled out form was sent seatbelt kit for free wow super through reply thank you so much the shower stuff did not even cross my mind will definitely buy gown or something because the hospital ones seem very uncomfortable and love the ipod idea music calms me so that should be huge help my son came two days after christmas and it was chilly was month early and had even had bag packed because was expecting him at all so that my list if had actually been prepared haha and do worry my picture of my son was getting down voted earlier huggies or pampers are definitely the two chose between zippers are easier imo im not talking about the snaps at the bottom of onesie talking head to toe snap outfits my wife does mind the snaps it great list and reddit can be tough sometimes head to toe snaps have always been on my no list they seem like they would be huge hassle thank you for the input this is very true and agreeing with someone above whole snap on outfits no go lol so hard when they start wiggling got my gowns from the thrift store figured they might get nasty they did but nothing that wo wash out the music was must for me it was especially excellent when was laboring in the tub also congratulations great advice our little one just barely fit into the newborn outfit and that may have been the only day she wore that size having the next size up would have been very helpful you could try for some maternity nursing pajamas got set that was nursing top also good for maternity and pants both super soft and one of my favorite items from the whole pregnancy wardrobe thank you we are absolutely over the moon ohhh think would like that more than gown like the snap footed pajamas so can just undo the bottom for diaper access and not have to take the whole thing off like the snap footed pajamas so can just undo the bottom for diaper access and not have to take the whole thing off cozy bathrobe and pajama shirt that buttons down the front target has good selection say go with slippers for walking around the room and flip flops for the shower thank you was planning on slippers but flip flops are great add chapstick and lots of underwear also make sure it an outfit that works with car seat not dress or sleeper definitely great recommendation with the nightgown… had sweats and they were pain however will disagree on the electric breast pump… the manual pump was ton of work for me… never use it now that have the electric one my kiddo loves her swing but wish had something that is easier to move around because bring it in different rooms with me during the day it comes in the kitchen while make breakfast are the hospital underwear uncomfortable deck of cards was in the hospital for 55 hours they tried to induce me it did work before had my son know this is common but you never know my mom ended up bring us deck because we got so bored sitting and waiting also snacks hospital food is expensive and the meals they bring suck and are always enough also it can be nice to have your own pillow for creature comfort the ones got were huge mesh ones needed underwear in my size otherwise they just fall right off do fuss with pricy diapers target brand or costco brand work great make sure you have 100+ on hand we have week old our 2nd and we are still going through 12 diapers day must medela lanolin disposable breast pads skip the individually wrapped ones menstrual pads liners sleep wire free nursing bras gowns for you and baby button down old man jammies great for nursing stool softener prenatals vibrating seat bouncer and swing get both ours loves them skip pump give yourself month to establish supply fancy maternity nursing pjs crib bedding you need to focus on bassinet or co sleeper first toys books buy as needed free and clear detergent we use tide and our newborn has reacted to it at all for the hospital we brought my laptop and watched probably 6+ episodes of scrubs because was induced and had lots of walking around to do would have been pretty bored otherwise for baby waste of money for us was newborn size clothes he outgrew them after maybe week and he was an average size baby also strongly recommend keeping tags on all clothes because babies can skip sizes or you ll learn certain types of clothes do work well for example footie pjs for my month old are hazard because he pulls up to stand and he needs his bare feet to grip also crib we cosleep for convenience and change table would have been waste of money we change his diaper everywhere just keep some diapers in different areas found out the hard way that could easily breastfeed but could pump so pump bottles accessories were waste of money also stroller never worked for us he still hates it even after daily walks for 4+ months baby carrier we use moby is much better and wayyy easier we ll try the stroller next summer though lingerie bag for your his socks best way to not lose them in the laundry would recommend to get about bags one for his room and one for the bathroom they usually only cost couple dollars extra laundry soap does not need to be fancy however free and clear or anything similar is great since it usually wont irritate the skin travel tissues great for when they are older and have so much snot think gas drops are not worth it they did help my son however depends on the kid same with teething tablets do like what some said about the socks as well as the mesh underwear and ice packs seriously have few extra labor is hard work and you deserve to be pampered after it sure plenty of electronics will be brought haha we so far have the most to month clothes than anything did already gets crib that has built in changer but sure we will change all over lol we also have stroller car seat combo but the stroller is mainly for jogging and walks have sling on my wishlist any specific recommendation wow so much info thank you makes sense ll get pack specifically for post birth snacks are great idea we have cards in the car so that easily done suggest black and stretchy to keep pads in place awesome thank you loving all these great suggestions and no nasty stains haha that was my idea with the stroller too lol did work out so well though our sidewalks in my city are also terrible which had considered prior love my moby it was great when my baby was really little and still use it at months good up to 35lbs but wrapping it is bit of hassle some days and the mei tei is similar in shape just not wrap sling is great too but both have their ups and downs ve heard tula are great but they can cost 400+ so have no experience with them due to their price point being little out of my budget lol the one have is called peanut sling went off of reviews on amazon not too big on the wraps they seem complicated and like they would be hot in texas also hard to breast feed in just keep in mind that most of it is trial and error to find what is best for you and you little guy ohh yes that big thing to consider too in northern ontario we already have snow and summer lasts shoot months here so the warner the better for us lol hope your baby enjoys stroller more than mine absolutely am mainly looking for ways to save on money and not buy completely useless stuff hope so too for my husband sake plan on wearing baby but he refuses to try the sling haha we got sporty looking graco jogging stroller with big bike like wheels and as long as baby is good in the car seat he should be ok with the stroller at least until he grows out of the car seat that snaps into it haha huggies little swaddlers movers are my favorite diapers however each brand fits and absorbs little differently so you might want to get one package of few different brands to see what works best for your baby before you buy huge supply of specific brand if you are in the us and have health insurance contact your carrier now to find out what pumps are available to you believe most plans now have to cover an electric pump for each pregnancy picked medela advanced pump and thought it worked well for me when went back to work or had to be away from baby think called around 30 weeks pregnant to order it bassinet would have been waste of money for us my son only slept in our room for 10 days before my husband insisted we move him to his crib in his own room the baby made so many noises when he slept that could relax or sleep because got worried over every little grunt in those first days he slept in our room in the pack and play which then was used for travel after that that said his video monitor was money well spent and made me feel calmer knowing could check and see what he was doing in his crib whenever wanted when packing your going home clothes be sure to pack something that fit when you were about months pregnant and not your pre baby clothes do expect to walk out of the hospital with flat belly also you re probably going to be taking some pictures of the baby going home so be sure whatever clothes you pick are things you would want to be photographed in my son was only days early but he dissappeared in newborn he came home in premie not with closed feeties though he was long amp skinny breast pads suppose everyone different but leaked like crazy as soon as my milk came in ve been leaking since about 26w so ve started using them already but know they will be must once have him haha my kids are 11 amp now but at the time lansinoh were the absolute best am pretty sure my insurance covers but do think get to keep the pump past certain amount of time am going back to work after my leave is up so need the pump as far as diapers am hoping people stop buying us clothes and start getting us diapers as of now we have box of diapers we do not have bassinet we have pack play sleeper and crib we plan on having the pack play in our room and living room accordingly would like to make use of the crib as most people know say they are waste but we ca use the pack play solely dermoplast my friends swore by it assumed the hospital gave it to you but mine did you can order it online or get it at places like walmart think it spray for down there to help relieve pain my son loved the swing and would nap in it all the time love our video monitor my son is and we still use it to this day also the rock and play sleeper by fisher price it light and easy to move from room to room my son slept in it next to our bed for the first months before we moved him to his crib good playmat will help keep them entertained and help with tummy time someone sent me nursing nightgown for the hospital and it was so nice to have instead of using the hospital gown she got it at target the bouncer was great for us as well also invest in good baby carrier that is easy to use some babies want to be held all the time and sometimes you need your hands the pack and play was waste for us we hardly used it just remember you can return anything you do like or use good luck thank you so much really want video monitor they seem like great investment this is all great advice but some hospitals do provide diapers did you do an l+d tour they can tell you what is provided and what you need to bring friend of mine just had her baby and the hospital did provide diapers she had no idea her husband had to go out and buy some would double check with your insurance about the pump according to the lactation consultant who ran the new mothers group used to attend the pumps given out by insurance companies are only intended for one user if that true ca imagine your company would want your pump back after you ve used it since they ca turn around and give it to anyone else the exception to this would be hospital grade pump because those are designed to be able to be sterilized and reused by another patient however those kind are portable so they do seem feasible for working mom **best things ** tummy tub http www sunros com au wotnot wipes so soothing no irritation not soapy ergo sport carrier muslins so useful for so many things still carry them now **worst things ** budget bouncinette bouncer rented pump that did work properly you may not need pump but did horrible rented car carrier that she was never comfortable in as she did like fully reclining any fancy clothes fiddly and she pooped ~10 times day all socks and booties it winter just use footed sleepsuits if you have upgraded your phone do so you will want the best camera available and take shit load of photos of and videos you will never regret taking too many check out babybumps there are tons of great posts about what was most useful totally useless great to have in hospital bag etc for diapers ve found that pampers are better when baby is long and huggies are better when baby is short chunky over packed my hospital bag but brought snacks drinks my own pillow comfortable clothes and some entertainment it really depends on how your labour goes so you may or may not need book tablet movie etc bring couple of outfits for baby in newborn and month sizes hat blanket your camera start using lanolin at 38 weeks it helps prep your nipples and you ll likely prevent some major problems did and did crack or bleed at all yes was so happy brought my slippers they felt like home we actually just upgraded phones thank you agree about diapers been through babies and have used virtually every kind out there target up amp up brand and luvs are my favorites by far and much cheaper than huggies pampers pampers smell horrible when soiled like poison ugh my daughters were both few weeks early we used premie sizes the first week or two true one of the reasons like luvs so much is cause they have that baby powdery smell and love it great you will not regret that proper cameras are great but you wo have them on you all the time well we are both into photography so the dslr camera is going with us to the hospital but know wo be whipping that big thing out every time take picture haha disagree with the pump my baby was such bad nurser he would suck on my nipple but bottle worked just fine for the the first few days recommend buy the pump better safe than sorry going to piggyback on this comment along with the icepacks get some witch hazel pads it helps with the itch and pain snacks are crazy important we ended up staying few extra days and it was expensive far away and crappy food bum clothing toiletries and my phone charger is all needed was good with the hospital socks and mesh undies so over packed for my family musthaves •the nose frida we lived in the desert and his nose always got stuffy used it daily muslin blankets for swaddling really loved the aden and anais ones they are light large and you can seriously find use for them all the time nursing tanks if you re going to bf nursing tanks are going to be your daily wear burp rags you can never have too many •my brest friend again if you re going to bf it would hurt to have it for me it was such challenge to bf and the brest friend was life saver baby wrap carrier were big hiking outdoor family and hate having to get out huge clunky stroller to get carton of milk just get baby out of the car seat strap up and walk out diapers •personally prefer huggie diapers softer more padding and pamper wipes they are soaking wet but when want to take his monthly pictures get small pack of the honest diapers la la love them soft and adorable patterns they are little more expensive if you go on there website they will send you sample package waste of money •receiving blankets too small to really do anything after the grow bigger than 10lbs use them as burp rags sometimes pack some hard candies like peppermint or suckers for you while in labor as they will only allow you to have ice chips you can suck on the candy just as well as ice great advice thank you for going into such detail had no idea candy was allowed that great did see this mentioned but apologize if it already was pads stock up and bring some to the hospital regardless if you go with section or vaginal birth you re going to need these another great thing found having epsom salt baths it soothing and helps heal everything up also tommee tippee is the best imo for bottles soothers etc huge congrats and wish you all the best of luck thank you for the suggestions and thank you for the congrats lol bought adult diapers it secret in the ring of new mommies guess it made visiting and sleeping much easier because knew was going to leak out in any direction you may want to invest in some cotton breast pads if you have already when you re engorged the first week the disposable pads can make it worse as the plastic backing wo allow your nipples to breathe cotton pads are also gentler so they feel nicer on sore nipples also check out buyingforbaby lots of people are saying the carrier but bear in mind most carriers are good until baby is at least pounds so you may or may not be able to use it right off do plan on using it for few weeks but as long as can carry him in my arms wo need it though know that gets tiring was planning on buying washable ones but ca seem to find them anywhere disposable is expensive and you do get too many that just ridiculous ve never heard of hospital that did provide diapers and offended on your friend behalf ours sent us home with extra honestly this is the most efficient way to go it insane how much bleeding you do post partum and no regular pad can possibly handle it agree thought the same you re paying them ridiculous amount of money least they could do is give you couple diapers what wonder too is if you go into labour spontaneously you re alone and were able to send someone hold the baby over sink lol especially if your insurance will cover it and most are mandated to cover it at 100 now thanks obama **do not skip the breast pump** some of these ladies may not have needed it but it vitally important for some of us and you have no way of knowing which camp you ll fall into ahead of time if your insurance does cover it and you need to buy it out of pocket just buy it and leave it in the box so you can return it if you wind up not needing it you *really* do want to need it and not have it on hand some babies wo latch properly and some mommies ca produce enough milk without going through relactation taking galactagogues and pumping like crazy good reliable pump like medela can be critical and if you plan on going back to work but maintaining nursing you just wo be able to do it without one you re fucking welcome gt start using lanolin at 38 weeks it helps prep your nipples and you ll likely prevent some major problems did and did crack or bleed at all good lord wish someone had told me that six years ago there are two kinds of pumps medical grade rental pumps and personal use pumps that are safe to share between more than one user about 99 sure that the affordable care act mandates that private insurance companies cover the personal use kind of pump not just the rental variety back when my kid was born pre aca had to buy my pump completely out of pocket but all of my friends who ve had their babies recently got theirs for free and keep them not that remember but it nice to have your own just in case agreed do not skip the pump and do skip the crib bedding you will decide where you want your babe to sleep and it may be the crib our little man still sleeps in the bassinet in our room but during the day and sometimes at night he sleeps in his crib it is important for them to experience different environments so they are better sleepers when they travel or are at other people houses we used dye fragrance free detergent at the start and slowly started incorporating my own detergent with his clothes he fine your babe may react though so you may want to try it this way also love books love them have ton and am glad because read to little one every day and the toys are good to help them start focusing on patterns colours red is their first shapes and sounds and another reply my guy loves his bouncer it vibrates and has detachable toy bar that he enjoys we bought the rainforest fisher price bouncer for 20 best 20 ever spent the vibrate function kept us sane the first couple of weeks when he was crazy crying or would not sleep your lo may like the swing better but he may not like either buy them second hand that way you re not spending shitton of money on things that may not be useful not sure how your hospital works but if your hubby can stay overnight make sure he brings pjs extra clothes that are comfy to wander help you labour in walking shoes food and water for him entertainment for him and swimming suit in case you get in the shower do forget the toiletries ve found million other uses for lanonlin also bought medela and it awesome chapped hands chapped nostrils cracked skin etc it wonderful have few kinds of diapers on hand but it is trial and error as to what works best we used huggies newborn which were fantastic and pampers size one which were fine huggies size one suck for us and kirkland size did too for bit costco brand but now we use kirkland size and pampers size overnights at the hospital have game plan do you want people visiting right after give yourself time to recover and rest and if you do want visitors just tell them we ll let you know when we are ready for visitors also brought my own tea as am picky brought microwaveable heat pad too and some cream that helped with pain management also had cold towel that soak in cold water and it stays cold but not dripping or damp for hours and that was amazing on my neck oh and doughnut pillow to sit on use it at home but bring it to the hospital and leave it in the car sitting on my seat was hell wish had that damn pillow with me bring water bottle with straw it will make it easier to sip on ask the nurses after labour for pain meds and for stool softener get on top of that asap and take it for the first few days downloaded baby connect which helped keep me sane it keeps track of nursing diapers pumping sleep etc doctors and nurses will ask you how long and how frequently baby is sleeping eating and pooping and this will help you keep track and also figure out why he is crying we do use mittens as our guy likes to self soothe but you may want some as baby nails are sharp hat and blanket just in case for the weather and going home clothes for you remember that these will be maternity as you ll still look about six months pregnant our hospital gave me mesh underwear and giant pads and got to keep my peri bottle spray it on your lady bits while you re peeing used few frozen pads doused with witch hazel but they warmed too quickly to be too effective you can freeze things like popcorn kernels or even cold hot pack and wrap that in towel and press it against your sore bits after and that works well also went to the depends underwear site and got few free samples and used these in conjunction with overnight maxi pads buy giant box you will need them the depends are comfortable much more so than regular underwear after while the mesh do work as well with the hospital pads when you re moving around so the depends with maxi pad in them are great hope that helps good luck loads of help my hospital has private rooms with private bathroom so the husband will be with me the whole time will make sure to pack his stuff to as he gets bored really easily haha do have medela pump on my amazon list it just needs to be purchased had no idea you could use the lanonlin for that much either we have swing that we got from yard sale that goes back and forth side to side and vibrates so hope he likes it but it was bought cheap if he does we already have about 90 of his bedding set just no mattress yet lol have already bought books to because plan on reading to him as well thank you that great information thank you absolutely getting pump because will be working it must for us know may not produce but rather be safe than sorry to piggyback off this bring your prenatals they have them at the hospital but they ll usually charge you like 40 bucks pop nice work am all about the secondhand items babies grow out of everything so fast private rooms are the best we drove 40 minutes to the other side of the city bypassing three hospitals just for this reason would have it any other way rather spend the money where it counts like the pump and bottles my hospital actually offers spa rooms with cable deluxe furnishings and sea soak tub for labor but it way pricey so the normal private delivery room will do haha wore house robe the whole time it was so easy for breastfeeding and more convenient than outfits want to know what you re supposed to do as well forgive me for being naive but why ca you put them in sleeper in car seat used always infinity pads they worked like charm and not once did leak out of them those things are god send for heavy flows just had my baby weeks ago and am still amazed at how well they worked would recommend nice pair of dark colored pajamas to put on after your 1st shower and some travel sized toiletries nice brand got mine from whole foods it made the experience feel little bit more swanky do worry about bringing pump the postpartum unit should be able to rent one or provide one for you if they have lactation department thank you can not recommend always infinity heavy flow pads enough the pads and awful underwear they gave me in the hospital were the worst things ever the nurse set the first up for me and layered two thick pads to make it long enough and still leaked immediately after getting up the first time after putting those on the infinity pads without wings were easily adjusted to where needed them and not once leaked second socks and cozy pants and panties there is no shame in doing much of anything to heal faster after you ve had the baby adult diapers vomit pale moomoo always think that so weird was allowed to eat whatever wanted during labor in the hospital you need to keep up your strength if you are planning to breastfeed have the number of good lactation consultant on hand it is worth it thank you mean the ones with the gown bottom… like this http www target com gerber newborn boys pack long sleeve transportation gown blue 15039244 prodslot= 15 sorry still have learned all of the names for baby clothes turns out pjs are sleepers… should win mother of the year lol oh okay no worries was just afraid was doing something wrong always put her in sleepers for the car rides
